comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "CINCINNATI CAR STRIKE ON.; Trolley Men Quit and Power House Workers Vote to Join Them" – New York Times, May 10, 1913. "SEEK FEDERAL AID IN OHIO CAR STRIKE; Cincinnati Company May Ask for Receivership and Regular Troops – Rioting Starts" – New York Times, May 12, 1913.

comment.author: 65405793@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called CincyVoices, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 46624315@N04
comment._content: May 9 1913 Street Railway employees go on strike. Strike breakers were brought in May 11. The strike was settled May 19 after violence had occurred. from Cincinnati: A Chronological and Documentary History ISBN 0379006030
